All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Activity
An activity one or more users can be performing.
CancelableEvent
An event that can be cancelled.
CancelableRoomEvent
An abstract event for events that hold a reference to a Room.
CancelableUserEvent
An abstract class from which cancelable events triggered by user actions inherit.
CancelableWorldEvent
An abstract event for events that hold a world object and can be cancelled.
ChangeRoomConnectionEvent
This class is only meant to group together ChangeRoomConnectionEvent.OneWay, ChangeRoomConnectionEvent.BothWays and ChangeRoomConnectionEvent.Disconnect.
ChangeRoomConnectionEvent.BothWays
The event is fired when a room's neighbors are updated to add a two ways connection between two rooms.
ChangeRoomConnectionEvent.Disconnect
This event is fired when a room's neighbors are updated to remove a connection between two rooms.
ChangeRoomConnectionEvent.OneWay
The event is fired when a room's neighbors are updated to add a one way connection from one room to another.
ChangeRoomDescriptionEvent
This event is fired when a room's description is updated.
ChangeRoomNameEvent
This event is fired when a room's name is changed.
Command
Implement this class to add custom game commands.
CommandExecutor
Something that can execute a command (either a user or the console).
Console
An administration console.
ConsoleInputEvent
 
ConversationAI
An AI that can hold a back and forth conversation.
DoNotCall
The annotated method is meant to be implemented by plugins, but calling it directly is not supported.
DoNotFire
The annotated event should not be fired by plugins but only subscribed to.
DoNotImplement
The annotated interface should not be implemented by plugins, and doing so is unsupported.
Event
Events are fired at specific steps of running the game server, so plugins can react and run their own code when needed.
FreeToCall
Plugins are free to call the annotated method.
FreeToFire
Plugins are free to fire events that are annotated with this annotation, and the server will react to them.
FreeToImplement
The annotated interface may be implemented by plugins.
Game
The game you will be interacting with.
GameConfig
The game's configuration.
GameState
The different states the game server can be in.
HandlerPriority
The priority an event subscribing method has over others.
Inventory
 
Item
An item users can collect and use.
NoSuchOptionException
This exception is thrown in Options when trying to access a key that does not exist without providing a default value.
Options
This interface allows plugins to store their own options in game files, in a key -> value manner.
Plugin
A plugin that can be loaded into the game.
PluginMetadata
The metadata loaded from a plugin's plugin.json metadata file.
Registry<T>
Registries store information about the various classes that implement gameplay related types, like Item.
Room
A room players can explore.
RoomInteraction
Represents something a User can interaction with inside a Room.
RoomInteractionEvent
Fired when a user interacts with something in a room.
SpawnRoomChangeEvent
This event is fired by the game when a world's spawn room is about to change.
StartNetworkEvent
This event is fired when the server's network system is about to start.
SubscribeEvent
Marks an object's method as subscribing to an event.
User
A user logged in the server.
UserChangesRoomEvent
Fired when a user attempts to move from one room to another.
UserConnectEvent
Fired when a user attempts to connect to the game server.
UserConnection
 
UserDropsItemEvent
Fired when a user drops an item.
UserItemEvent
A generic cancelable event used whenever a user interacts with an item.
UserJoinEvent
This event is fired once a user has joined the server.
UserLogInEvent
This event is fired when a user is trying to log in with a given username.
UserPicksUpItemEvent
Fired when a user picks up an item from a room.
UserUsesItemEvent
Fired when a user uses an item.
World
A world the server is running.
WorldEvent
An abstract event for events that hold a world object and cannot be cancelled.
WorldLoadEvent
This class simply exists to group together WorldLoadEvent.Pre and WorldLoadEvent.Post
WorldLoadEvent.Post
This event is fired after the world has loaded.
WorldLoadEvent.Pre
This event is fired before the world is loaded.
